content.title: Internship Scheme For PG/Research Students In Directorate General Of Trade Remedies (DGTR)
content.details: The Internship Scheme by the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR), Department of Commerce, Ministry of Commerce & Industry provides opportunity to young scholars, especially from Law / Economics stream, interested in learning about trade remedial investigations. The objective of this scheme is to familiarize interested and willing PG students / Research scholars with Trade remedial investigations / Trade Defence measures.
eligibility: The applicant should be a Postgraduate Student or a Research Scholar from a recognized University/Institute.
The Internship should be a part of their Course curriculum or undertaken as an additional assignment during the annual vacations.
exclusions: No financial aid / stipend will be provided by this Directorate to the interns.
content.application_process: The interested PG students / Research scholars may send their application in the prescribed proforma along with their CV (optional) either by post or by-hand to reach the General Administration Section, Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR), Ministry of Commerce, Jeevan Tara Building, New Delhi, Delhi 110001. The application should be sent at least one month in advance from the date the applicant intends to join.
documents_required: A permission / forwarding letter from their Supervisor or Head of Department of the Institute at the time of Application.
A brief report / paper at the end of their assignment /internship.

faqs.question: Who Can Apply For The Internship In DGTR?
faqs.answer: Postgraduate students or research scholars from recognized universities/institutes can apply.

faqs.question: What Is The Objective Of The Internship Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective is to familiarize interested PG students/research scholars with trade remedial investigations and trade defense measures.

faqs.question: What Is The Minimum Duration Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: The minimum duration of the internship is one month.

faqs.question: How Will The Interns Be Assigned To Officers In DGTR?
faqs.answer: The interns will be attached to an officer who will act as their mentor and design a suitable schedule for them.

faqs.question: Will Financial Support Or Stipend Be Provided To The Interns?
faqs.answer: No, DGTR does not provide any financial aid or stipend to the interns.

faqs.question: Will The Interns Receive A Certificate Upon Completion Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: Yes, certificates will be issued to the interns upon successful completion of the internship.

faqs.question: What Are The Eligibility Criteria For Applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants should be postgraduate students or research scholars from recognized universities/institutes.

faqs.question: How Should Interested PG Students/Research Scholars Submit Their Applications?
faqs.answer: Interested applicants can send their application in the prescribed format along with their CV (optional) either by post, email, or by hand to the General Administration Section of DGTR.

faqs.question: How Much In Advance Should The Application Be Sent Before The Intended Joining Date?
faqs.answer: The application should be sent at least one month in advance from the date the applicant intends to join.

faqs.question: How Many Interns Will Be Selected For The Internship?
faqs.answer: The number of interns to be selected will be decided by DGTR.

faqs.question: Is The Internship A Job Or An Assurance For A Job In The Department/Organization/Government?
faqs.answer: No, the internship in DGTR is neither a job nor an assurance for a job in the department/organization/government.

faqs.question: Can DGTR Terminate The Internship Of An Intern?
faqs.answer: Yes, DGTR reserves the right to terminate the internship of any intern at any point in time without assigning any reason.
